bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Donald Kerracher - Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: To the Honorable C.B. Hopkins, united States Marshal:

It is hereby ordered and directed that the above entitled matter having come on regurlarly to be heard before this court on the 20th day of September A.D. 1905, Donald MCKerracher, the peti- tioner herein, being represented by his counsel Messrs, Metcalfe amp Jurey, and the United States Attorney for this District, Jesse A Frye, and all the matters tehrin involved being duly heard, and the court fully advised in the premises, this court has regurlarly held and deter- mined that Donald McKerracher, a prisoner now held in custody by you at the penitentiary at McNeil's Island, in the State of Washington, is unlawfully held in custody, his term of imprisonment having expired as provided by the law.
Therefore, you are hereby ordered and directed to forthwith discharge from custody and imprisonment the said Donald McKerra- cher
Done in open Court this 20th day of September, 1905. Attest A. Reeves, Clerk. Hm W Brinker Deputy Clekr
